_usage: Copy this file to ~/.config/cconductor/stakeholder-patterns.json and customize for your domains
_purpose: Extend auto-detected stakeholder mappings for niche domains without editing core code

safety_advocates._description: Independent safety advocacy groups and victim families

regional_regulators._description: Aviation regulators outside FAA/EASA (Transport Canada, CASA Australia, etc.)

medical_researchers._description: Academic medical researchers and clinical trial investigators (healthcare domain)

patient_advocates._description: Patient advocacy organizations and support groups (healthcare domain)

independent_security_researchers._description: Independent security researchers and bug bounty hunters (tech domain)

open_source_maintainers._description: Open source project maintainers and contributors (tech domain)

_instructions.when_to_use: Add patterns here when you see 'uncategorized sources' warnings in quality-gate-summary.json and those sources represent important stakeholder perspectives

how_patterns_work.domain_patterns: URL fragments that match source domains (e.g., 'faa.gov' matches 'https://www.faa.gov/newsroom/statement')
how_patterns_work.keyword_patterns: Terms that appear in source titles or snippets (case-insensitive)
how_patterns_work.matching: A source matches a category if it matches ANY domain pattern OR ANY keyword pattern

_instructions.how_to_verify: After adding patterns, run a mission and check research-sessions/mission_*/artifacts/quality-gate-summary.json for reduced uncategorized_sources.count
best_practices: Use specific domain patterns (e.g., 'tc.gc.ca' not just '.ca')
Include multiple keyword variations ('safety advocate', 'advocacy group')
Test with a small mission first to verify patterns work
Document why you added each category (helps team maintenance)
